title.narrative: Global Programme: Enhancing Readmission and Legal Identity Capacity (RELICA)

description.narrative: To enhance legal identity capacity and address related readmission challenges, nationally as well as globally. Against this backdrop, IOM proposes to support legal identity needs in selected states through and with the ultimate objective of a global rollout of the eRCMS. National actions will enhance legal identity capacities in selected countries, but also serve to gather experiences from diverse contexts for a further eRCMS rollout.

sector.narrative: Facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 2.3 Capacity building training for the government on relevant topics

1. Number of training sessions (ID masterclass, ToT, cascading trainings) for first- and second-line officers from the MoI’s Residency Department on technical aspects of identity management
2. Percentage of trainees who have an increased knowledge on the technical capacities to efficiently collect data and process data and information after the training.
Means of verification: Training reports, attendance lists, agenda of the training sessions; training evaluation, pre and post-test.

target.value:
1. 1 ID management masterclass, 2 ToT trainings, 1 5-day cascading trainings
2. 75%

title.narrative: 2.4 Study visits for the government to gain knowledge on technological solutions for systems such as the eRCMS

1. Number of study visits organized and undertaken during the project
2. Percentage of participants who consider that they have gained practical experience and knowledge of different systems currently operated by other countries
Means of verification: Study visit reports, attendance list; study visit evaluation.
1.1 A national intergovernmental taskforce is put in place to lead the migration and border management policy formulation and implementation.

1. Number of meetings of the National Coordination Mechanisms on Migration and Task force
2. Number of stakeholders who engage in the process
Means of verification: Minutes of the meetings; attendance list
2.1 Central Registry Office’s archive of foreigner’s nationality attribution is fully digitalized and easily accessible through a database.

Number of foreigner’s nationality attribution applicant’s files digitized.
Means of verification: Digitalization Report extracted from its software after conclusion of work.
2.3 Immigrant’s Extraordinary Regularization equipped with biometric data readers.

Number of portable biometric data reader donated.
Means of verification: Review of Donation Acceptance Form Signed.
1.1 An assessment of the current legal identity systems of El Salvador, Somalia and Viet Nam is conducted

A better understanding of the three countries’ current legal identity architecture on the following two areas: (1) processes related to civil registry and the Unified ID system and (2) the identity management chain (from the collection of biometrics to the analysis of data and development of reports) (Y/N) Means of verification: Findings from a preliminary review study on the three countries’ current legal identity system; information obtained from field visits and the governments in question

target.value: Yes - Gain a comprehensive overview of the current status quo of El Salvador, Somalia and Viet Nam’s legal identity architecture from a technical, operational, institutional, legal and digital viewpoint.

title.narrative: 1.2. Infrastructure and equipment are provided to the government to strengthen the legal identity system

A range of competitive infrastructure and equipment is provided based on the findings of the assessment (Output 1.1). (Y/N) Means of verification: Monitoring of installation and use of infrastructure and equipment; information obtained from field visits and the GoI.

target.value: Yes - The GoI is better equipped to identify its nationals more efficiently and securely, thanks to a legal identity system utilizing the infrastructure and equipment provided.

title.narrative: 2.2 Operational strengthening on identified and prioritized gaps.

1. A range of competitive infrastructure and equipment is provided based on the findings of the assessment (Output 2.1). (Y/N)
2. Number of training sessions for relevant GoR officials, including a ToT, to ensure the new equipment and upgraded data management is properly understand and can be successfully utilized.
Means of verification: Monitoring of installation and use of infrastructure and equipment; information obtained from field visits and the GoI.

target.value: Yes - The GoR is better equipped and its IT and data management operational capacities are strengthened.

title.narrative: 2.2 Workshops with government on technical identity management and capacity development.

Recommendations from the assessments have been validated by the GoI and next steps have been formulated to strengthen Iraq’s legal identity system. (Y/N)
Means of verification: Availability of validated recommendations from the assessments on Iraqi’s legal identity architecture and of the IT systems relating to legal identity; insights from the GoI’s working group on Data Management and Identity and Risk Analysis (to be established) as to how the recommendations can be implemented.

target.value: Yes - findings from the assessments have been shared, discussed and validated with the GoI and a way forward identified.

title.narrative: 1.1 National Programme for the Reception and (Re)Integration of Forced Returnee Migrants under the Readmission Agreement are structured and formalized, including the introduction of eRCMS.

Existence of National Programme for the Reception and (Re)Integration of Returned Migrants. (Y/N)
Means of verification: Detailed review of the programme document.

target.value: Yes – A National Programme for the Reception and (Re)Integration of Returned Migrants has been established.

title.narrative: 2.1. An assessment of Iraq’s functional IT systems relating to legal identity is conducted to support eRCMS roll out.

A better understanding of Iraq’s needs and current capacity of functional IT systems relating legal identity, to customise the eRCMS to Iraq’s context (Y/N).
Means of verification: Assessment and System Design reports available

target.value: Yes – Iraq’s IT systems relating to legal identity fully mapped and understood based on an assessment and a System Design report is also produced

title.narrative: 1.1. In close coordination with GoI, an assessment of Iraq’s current legal identity system is conducted

A better understanding of Iraq’s current legal identity architecture is gained in the following two areas: (1) processes related to civil registry and the Unified ID system and (2) the identity management chain (from the collection of biometrics to the analysis of data and development of reports). (Y/N)
Means of verification: Assessment reports

target.value: Yes – Iraq’s legal identity system is thoroughly mapped and understood through an assessment.

title.narrative: 2.1 Identify gaps in the data management system and operational capacities through a needs assessment

A better understanding of Rwanda’s needs and current capacity of ifs functional data management systems.
Means of verification: Assessment and System Design reports available

target.value: Yes – Rwanda’s data management system and operational capacities fully mapped and understood based on an assessment and a System Design report is also produced

title.narrative: 1.2 A National Migration Policy is drafted and approved

A comprehensive and overarching National Migration Policy is drafted and approved by all border agencies and specialized agencies with a mandate that partially relates to border management operations (Y/N).
Means of verification: review of GoR’s National Migration Policy before and after, inclusion of border management operations mandate, and level of approval of the policy document among relevant agencies.
2.2 Support the digitalization of legal identity request processes for nationals and foreigners for swift return to and from Cabo Verde through eRCMS.

Existence of Online platform for the issuance of 2nd copy and renewal of all legal identification.
Means of verification: Detailed review of platform accessible online.
Outcome 2 Cabo Verde: Legal Identity Issuance Capacity in Cabo Verde is upgraded and enhanced.

1. Percentage of request for issuance of 2nd copy and renewal of all legal identification received through the online platform.
2. Number of days reduced for issuance of 2nd copy and renewal of all legal identification.
3. Number of weeks reduced for rectifications request of registry records registered in the Registry Office.
Means of verification: Review of the platform report and comparative analyse with the in-person service, 12 months after the introduction of the online platform; Review of the Registry Office reports and comparative analyse with the previous service performance reports, 12 months after the conclusion of the digitalization process.

target.value:
1. 60% of request received online.
2. 2 days reduced
3. 1 week reduced

title.narrative: Outcome 1 Rwanda: Rwanda’s Migration Management framework is strengthened through the development of a comprehensive National Migration Policy and the establishment of national coordination on migration issues.

1. The GoR has a comprehensive policy framework that paves the way for border management operations, including return and readmission, as well as identity management. (Y/N)
2. National coordination on migration issues is established and reinforced. (Y/N)
Means of verification: The National Gazette (sharing publications of the Republic of Rwanda), final version of the new migration policy framework, minutes of meetings between government entities on the re-installment of the taskforce on migration.

target.value:
1. Yes - a comprehensive policy framework that successfully addresses issues related to border management operations, including return and readmission, as identity management.
2. Yes - A national intergovernmental taskforce is put in place to lead the migration and border management policy formulation and implementation.

title.narrative: Outcome 1 Cabo Verde: Cabo Verde’s National Capacity Response to implement the Readmission Agreement and reception the Forced Returnee Migrants in the country is enhanced.

Numbers of Forced Returnee Migrants successfully received and integrated into the Cabo Verdean Society.
Means of verification: Interview with a sample of Forced Returnee Migrants assisted under the new programme administered 18 months after project implementation using structured questionnaire.

target.value: 240 of Forced Returnee Migrants, disaggregated by sex and age

title.narrative: Outcome 2 Iraq: The government has strengthened capacity to implement return and readmission process
Number of government entities with the capacity to implement return and readmission processes in a coordinated manner. Means of verification: Reports from workshops, training and study visits

target.value: 5 - This includes the key entities responsible for return and readmission such as MoI Residency Department, Legal Department, the Border Guards Force (BGF), the Iraqi National Intelligence Service (INIS) and MoFA.

title.narrative:
Outcome 1 IOM Denmark coordination of the Global Program, liaison with Danish Counterparts, and prospective assessments in El Salvador, Somalia and Viet Nam:
Gain a comprehensive understanding of the needs on legal identity and readmission for Somalia, Viet Nam and El Savador in light of the further global rollout of eRCMS.

The final assessment report demonstrates a clear and comprehensive understanding of the needs on readmission and legal identity in El Salvador, Somalia and Viet Nam (Y/N).
Means of verification: Final assessment report outlining gaps and providing recommendations

target.value: Yes - Gain a comprehensive overview of the current status quo of El Salvador, Somalia and Viet Nam’s legal identity architecture from a technical, operational, institutional, legal and digital viewpoint.

title.narrative: Outcome 1 Iraq: National legal identity infrastructure, processes and systems are developed and strengthened to support safe and orderly migration and to lay the groundworks for eRCMS roll-out.

A better understanding of Iraq’s current legal identity architecture is gained in the following two areas: (1) processes related to civil registry and the Unified ID system and (2) the identity management chain (from the collection of biometrics to the analysis of data and development of reports). (Y/N)
Means of verification: Assessment reports

target.value: Yes - GoI legal identity system is upgraded in a number of key locations to allow for better access to digitised identification.

title.narrative: Outcome 2 Rwanda: IT and software operational capacities are strengthened and modernized to allow for eRCMS initiation

Identified existing gaps in Rwanda’s IT and identity management unit are filled so that the government’s IT and operational capacities are ready for eRCMS initiation (Y/N) Identified existing gaps in
Means of verification: Progress and final results report, outlining clearly the improvements and progress made.
